subject: Quickscript letters
msgSnippet: Hello, I just found out about Quickscript a month or two ago, and I am learning how to write in it. I m a big fan of alternate writing systems, and I ve
messageBody:
Hello,

   I just found out about Quickscript a month or two ago, and I am learning how to write in it.  I'm a big fan of alternate writing systems, and I've invented and memorized several myself.  I even tried to learn Gregg shorthand once, but finally gave up since it wasn't phonemic.  Anyway, in the process of learning Quickscript, I've come across a question about it:
  1. I see there are three letters, which are described as having the sounds of "calm", "haul", and " on", respectively.  In my dialect of English (I live in Texas), all three of these are pronounced the same!  For example, I pronounce the words "caught" and "cot" with the same vowel sound as is in "awe".  How should I do this in Quickscript?  I don't really want to memorise how other people pronounce certain words in order to spell Quickscript right.
   I think Quickscript looks like a really great alphabet, and I'm looking forward to being able to read and wright it.  It would be great if it were more widely used, but it's kind of like trying to teach Esperanto to everyone in the world; English is so widespread, it would have to be an international thing.

   Anyway, please let me know if any of y'all can help me with this, and I'll keep working on it!

   Thanks.

-Benjamin Bruce
